data.title: Thailand-South Korea economic partnership agreement nears completion
data.description: The Thailand-South Korea economic partnership agreement (EPA) to further boost economic partnership between the two countries should be finalised next year, Commerce Minister Pichai Naripthaphan said on Wednesday.

data.title: Pichet Klunchun goes back to the future at new Bangkok venue
data.description: Two fresh contemporary dance performances set to open space converted from a historic movie studio

data.title: Korean live streamer arrested for injuring massage operator
data.description: PATTAYA — A Korean live streamer has been arrested for allegedly injuring the owner of a massage parlour while attempting to block his live coverage of a client

data.title: She was a child Instagram influencer. Her fans were grown men.
data.description: NEW YORK — For her 18th birthday in March, "Jacky Dejo," a snowboarder, bikini model and child influencer turned social media entrepreneur, celebrated on the secluded island of Dominica.

data.title: Jake Paul vows to knock out Mike Tyson
data.description: IRVING —  Jake Paul  is betting on himself to beat  boxing  legend  Mike Tyson  when the pair meet in the ring in  Texas  on Friday in what the  social media  star turned prize-fighter predicts will be a slugfest.

data.title: Thais urged to change habits as diabetes cases cross 6.5 million
data.description: Health minister Somsak Thepsutin says experts estimate that as many as 40% of those with type 2 diabetes are undiagnosed

data.title: Thai businesses recognised at Corporate Social Impact Awards
data.description: American Chamber honours corporate social impact excellence in Thailand,  praises reductions in carbon emissions

data.title: Ministry outlines plan to crackdown on nominee businesses
data.description: Foreign business using Thai nominees to face severe penalties under new plans, Commerce Ministry subcommittee says

data.title: Lisa thrills fans at Bangkok meet-and-greet
data.description: Thai global sensation Lalisa “Lisa” Manoban gave another spectacular performance at her latest fan meeting in Bangkok on Wednesday, thrilling both local and international supporters whilst dropping hints about her forthcoming full-length album.

data.title: Federation of Thai Industries concerned at Trump’s reshoring policy
data.description: US president-elect’s ‘America First’ vow could see US companies intending to relocate to Thailand make an about turn

data.title: Bright lights, big city
data.description: For those trying to find a spot to bask in the joyful mood after releasing a krathong into the Chao Phraya River tomorrow night, the charming neighbourhoods of Phra Nakhon-Pak Klong Talat have been turned into entertainment destinations for the seventh Awakening Bangkok, which runs until this Sunday.

data.title: Gastroscopy boost Thai medical expertise for greater treatment efficiency
data.description: Since 2014, Samitivej has partnered with Sano Hospital, Japan’s leading private hospital specializing in advanced diagnosis and therapeutics via gastrointestinal (GI) endoscopy, to improve the efficacy of diagnosis, treatment and care for patients with gastrointestinal disorders.

data.title: Peeradol to skipper Thai side in Thursday night's match
data.description: Thailand go into their Fifa Day friendly with Lebanon Thursday night under a new captain.

data.title: Airbus forecasts Asia-Pacific to require 19,500 new aircraft by 2043
data.description: Airbus has released its latest regional market forecast, projecting that the Asia-Pacific aviation sector will require 19,500 new aircraft over the next 20 years. This demand represents 46% of the global requirement, which is expected to reach around 42,430 new aircraft by 2043.

data.title: Kunlavut, Ratchanok and Supanida win openers in Japan
data.description: Kunlavut Vitidsarn, Ratchanok Intanon and Supanida Katethong advanced to the last 16 of the US$420,000 BWF Kumamoto Masters Japan in Kumamoto Wednesday.

data.title: Kodindy music festival to raise funds for Mae Sai flood victims
data.description: The 16th Kodindy Charity Music Festival, a long-standing event dedicated to fostering indie music and giving back to the community, is set to take place on November 29.

data.title: Thaksin to be quizzed on PGH stay
data.description: Former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra will be summoned by a House committee to provide information related to claims that he received privileged treatment at Police General Hospital (PGH) during his detention there.

data.title: Artist invites all to inner reflection
data.description: Art viewers are encouraged to focus deeper on inner reflection during "Goood Luck: Glitter Gaze", which is running at Tang Contemporary Art Bangkok until Dec 15.

data.title: Jailed Sittra grilled over Senate run
data.description: Embattled  lawyer Sittra Biabungkerd  was quizzed on Wednesday by election officials for allegedly having run for the Senate despite being unqualified to seek the post.

data.title: Krathongs float, balloons fly at Muang Thong Thani
data.description: Impact Lakefront at Muang Thong Thani invites everyone to float their  krathongs  into the lake and enjoy balloons in the sky during Loy Rim Lake 2024, which will kick off Friday and run daily from 4.30pm to 11pm until Sunday.

data.title: Photo exhibition captures the essence of change
data.description: Scientific theories are integrated with art during "Transformation Theory", which is running at West Eden Gallery until Dec 22.

data.title: Bangkok traffic alert as construction starts
data.description: Motorists have been warned to expect heavy  traffic congestion  as the Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) will close and demolish three key traffic flyovers during construction of the Orange Line electric train route, which starts on Friday.

data.title: Study-work policy to keep kids in class
data.description: The Digital Economy and Society Ministry is pushing a policy allowing students to earn additional income while studying in a bid to bring out-of-school children back into the classroom.

data.title: Civil groups urge govt to back global plastics treaty
data.description: Civil society organisations (CSOs) have called on the government to take action against plastic pollution and show its support for a global treaty on plastics.

data.title: Phuket sets road map to protect migrant dugongs
data.description: Phuket is forming a working group to care for about 30  dugongs  that have migrated from the coasts of Trang and Krabi to areas around Rawai Beach.

data.title: Thai hotels wary of foreign competition in peak tourist season
data.description: While the Thai hotel industry is experiencing a rebound in demand in line with the peak tourist season, concerns are growing over increasing competition from foreign businesses.

data.title: Major UK media group quits ‘toxic’ X
data.description: LONDON - The British news publisher the Guardian said on Wednesday it would no longer post to X, citing “disturbing content” on the social media platform, including racism and conspiracy theories.

data.title: 'Digital hub' policies bear fruit
data.description: Prime Minister  Paetongtarn Shinawatra  has pledged to turn Thailand into a regional hub for the  digital economy , implementing this vision through a suite of policies.

data.title: Major UK media group quits ‘toxic’ X
data.description: LONDON - The British news publisher the Guardian said on Wednesday it would no longer post to X, citing “disturbing content” on the social media platform, including racism and conspiracy theories.

data.title: 2001 Cambodia document ‘still the best way forward’
data.description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs has reiterated that Thailand has never revoked the memorandum of understanding ( MoU ) from 2001 related to its overlapping  maritime claims  with  Cambodia , emphasising that it is the best mechanism to protect the country’s interests.

data.title: Thaksin to be quizzed on ‘privileged’ hospital stay
data.description: Former prime minister  Thaksin Shinawatra  will be summoned by a House committee to provide information related to claims that he received  privileged treatment  at the  Police General Hospital  (PGH) during his detention there.

data.title: House Speaker agrees to discuss charter
data.description: House Speaker Wan Muhammad Noor Matha has agreed to meet a House committee on political development, mass communication and public participation to discuss constitutional amendments later this month.

data.title: Khao Kradong dispute stalls as House Committee quorum fails after MP walkout
data.description: Opposition MP says the House committee he chairs will soon review the dispute focusing solely on facts with transparency and integrity, free from political influence

data.title: Authorities assure Koh Phangan is safe
data.description: Security authorities in Surat Thani province have offered assurances that  Koh Phangan  is safe, dismissing reports about a possible  terror plot  against  Israelis  on the tourist island as untrue.

data.title: True Corp Showcases Emergency Alert System with Live Test
data.description: True Corporation Plc., Thailand’s leading telecom-tech company, conducted a live demonstration of its “LIVE – Cell Broadcast Service,” showcasing the system’s readiness for the Committee on Communications, Telecommunications, and Digital Economy and Society of the House of Representatives. The event welcomed Mr Pakornwut Udompipatskul, (Second) Vice-Chairperson of the Committee, along with subcommittee members, to witness and participate in testing the emergency alert system, which will be launched in Thailand for the first time. Attendees also toured the Business and Network Intelligence Centre (BNIC), which is utilised for disaster management.

data.title: Ammonia leak at Pattani ice plant sickens 18
data.description: PATTANI - Local residents were evacuated and schools closed after an ammonia leak at an ice plant sickened 18 people in Muang district of this southern border province on Wednesday.
